comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: James Gordon Bennett Jr. was the multi-millionaire owner of a daily newspaper  --the New York Herald -- a yachtsman, and sponsor of the Bennett cups in automobile and aeroplane racing. Although he had mansions in the U.S., he spent most of his time in Europe. In September, 1914, in Paris, at age 73, he married for the first time -- a widow of about 50.

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks Wystan, for the information distinguishing the life of the son from the father who had the same name.  We'll fill in the caption the next time we update the record.
